items.stem: What is the main purpose of personal hygiene in food handling?
options: To prevent microorganisms and contaminants reaching food
items.rationale: Hygiene controls the transfer of microbes from people to food.

options: Wet, soap, rub, backs, between fingers, rinse and dry
items.rationale: That is the six-step sequence shown in the training.

items.stem: When must hands be washed? Select all that apply.
options: Only at the start of the shift
items.rationale: Wash before RTE, after raw, and after any contamination risk like phones.

items.stem: Which statement about gloves is correct?
options: Gloves must be changed between tasks and hands washed
Gloves can be worn all day
Gloves make food safe even if dirty
items.rationale: Gloves are single-task and do not replace handwashing.

items.stem: What should you do if you have diarrhoea or vomiting?
options: Report it and stay off for 48 hours after last symptom
items.rationale: Exclusion for 48 hours is standard to prevent spread.

options: Wear outdoor coats in prep if clean
Reuse single-use gloves after washing them
Remove aprons for bins and toilet, then replace
items.rationale: Aprons off for dirty tasks. Cuts must be covered with blue plasters.
